title: Scope 1 (Trust & Safety): Remove implied mood inference and auto-suggestion language

requirements.text: Audit and update all user-facing copy so it never implies the app knows, detects, or infers how the user (or the circle) feels; all language must frame insights as patterns based on what users selected/posted (e.g., “You selected low moods” / “Posts this week leaned calm”).

quotes: Remove any language implying the system knows how the user feels
Analyzer talks about patterns, not emotions ("You selected low moods" vs "You felt low")

acceptanceCriteria: No UI text claims or implies the system can tell how a user feels without the user explicitly selecting a mood (avoid phrases like “we know”, “you felt”, “your circle feels”, “your mood indicates distress”).
Where the app summarizes history, the text explicitly references “your selected moods”, “your entries”, “your posts”, or equivalent agency-preserving phrasing.
All updated strings are in English.

requirements.text: Update the Mood Analyzer UI and its generated guidance text to use agency-preserving, non-inferential wording that describes distributions/trends of selected moods, not emotional states; ensure the analyzer description and guidance do not use clinical/diagnostic framing.

quotes: Analyzer talks about patterns, not emotions ("You selected low moods" vs "You felt low")

acceptanceCriteria: In frontend/src/components/profile/MoodAnalyzerCard.tsx, the card subtitle and section labels do not describe “emotional patterns” as something the system determines; they are framed as analysis of the user’s selections/entries.

In frontend/src/utils/moodAnalysis.ts, guidance text uses wording like “Based on your selected moods/entries…” and avoids “you felt…”, “emotional well-being”, “distress”, “clinical consideration”, or diagnosis-like language.
If there are 0 entries, the empty-state guidance does not instruct users to “share your feelings”; it invites them to select moods/check in to see patterns.

requirements.text: Ensure the mood picker and check-in flow remain fully user-chosen: no default pre-selection, no auto-suggested mood, and no copy that implies a recommendation or guess; adjust surrounding copy in compose and reminder surfaces to reinforce user choice.
acceptanceCriteria: In frontend/src/components/status/MoodPicker.tsx and frontend/src/pages/ComposeStatusPage.tsx, no mood is auto-selected and no “suggested mood” UI is introduced.
Compose page copy (e.g., title, description, note placeholder) is updated to reflect choosing/sharing what the user wants (not what the app thinks they feel).
Mood reminder card text is updated to avoid implying the app is checking how the user feels; it invites the user to choose a mood/check in.

requirements.text: Update Circle Energy summary text to avoid claiming the system knows the circle’s feelings (remove/replace phrases like “Your circle feels…”), reframing summaries as patterns observed in posts over the last week.

quotes: Remove any language implying the system knows how the user feels

acceptanceCriteria: In frontend/src/utils/circleEnergy.ts, generated summaries do not use “feels” language implying emotional inference; they reference posting trends (e.g., “Posts this week leaned calm/mixed…”).
A quick scan of the returned summary templates confirms no diagnostic/clinical language is introduced.

requirements.text: Update login/onboarding/product copy that currently emphasizes the app understanding or holding feelings so it instead emphasizes user choice and private sharing of selected moods, while keeping the existing calm tone.

quotes: Remove any language implying the system knows how the user feels

acceptanceCriteria: In frontend/src/constants/loginCopy.ts, rotating hero/card copy no longer says “share your feelings” in a way that could imply the app is interpreting them; it references sharing what you choose / the moods you select.
Foundation copy remains consistent with Scope 1: it should describe noticing patterns from check-ins without implying inference.

constraints: Do not edit any files under frontend/src/components/ui (read-only UI component sources).
Do not modify frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, or frontend/src/main.tsx (immutable paths).
Respect the existing single-page React app architecture and React Query patterns; no new backend services.
nonGoals: Do not add any new mood recommendation, auto-suggestion, or inferred mood feature.
Do not change backend data models or canister APIs as part of Scope 1 unless strictly necessary for copy-only changes (expected: not necessary).
Do not implement new clinical safety features, crisis flows, or professional-care escalation beyond copy changes requested in Scope 1.
